content: I don't know if this is related, but there are a few merge commits at the top of 1.x that add a .lando.yml, as well as a composer.json, and a .travis.yml.

Hi, John Franklin. Welcome to the Backdrop CMS community on Zulip. I'm your friendly neighborhood Dragonbot. Try '@Dragonbot help' for a list of things I can help you with. There are lots of friendly humans that hang around here, so please feel free to ask questions.

Here is a short (3 min) video to help you navigate Zulip. https://youtu.be/DN8YL2MrsSU

I have the following alias in my ~/.gitconfig: 

[alias]
    lg = log --color --graph --pretty=format:'%Cred%h%Creset -%C(yellow)%d%Creset %s %Cgreen(%cr) %C(bold blue)<%an>%Creset' --abbrev-commit

and with that, a git lg origin/1.x will show what I'm talking about.
Neither the commits nor the merges have issue numbers. Was this intentional?
Sorry @John Franklin which commits are you referring to?

*   0b0519200 - (HEAD -> 1.x, origin/1.x) Merge branch '1.x' into 1.x (19 hours ago) <Herb>
|\
| *   194aeb6da - Merge remote-tracking branch 'core/1.x' into 1.x (6 months ago) <Geoff St. Pierre>
| |\
| * \   98fdb084b - Merge remote-tracking branch 'core/1.x' into 1.x (6 months ago) <Geoff St. Pierre>
| |\ \
| * \ \   25ff548b2 - Merge remote-tracking branch 'core/1.x' into 1.x (1 year, 3 months ago) <Geoff St. Pierre>
| |\ \ \
| * | | | 6cbbd446a - Remove composer.lock, min stability, and fix typo. (1 year, 5 months ago) <Geoff St. Pierre>
| * | | | 603b3c64d - Adding composer instruction to README.md. (1 year, 5 months ago) <Geoff St. Pierre>
| * | | | 6454c9c78 - Validate the composer.json file. (1 year, 5 months ago) <Geoff St. Pierre>
| * | | | 27e9c83e9 - Remove version string in favor of git tags. (1 year, 5 months ago) <Geoff St. Pierre>
| * | | | 7fc7f6ef8 - Adding version info to composer.json. (1 year, 5 months ago) <Geoff St. Pierre>
| * | | | 3a6f0daf1 - Update composer.json with installer paths. (1 year, 5 months ago) <Geoff St. Pierre>
| * | | | d7e808809 - Adding .travis.yml config. (1 year, 5 months ago) <Geoff St. Pierre>
| * | | | b6e80f1d0 - Adding composer.json. (1 year, 5 months ago) <Geoff St. Pierre>
| * | | |   e72e34fbf - Merge remote-tracking branch 'core/1.x' into 1.x (1 year, 5 months ago) <Geoff St. Pierre>
| |\ \ \ \
| * | | | | 1ecf914ac - Adding .lando.yml config file for dev convenience. (1 year, 5 months ago) <Geoff St. Pierre>
| * | | | | 514e7bb9d - Ignore the vendor dependencies directory. (1 year, 5 months ago) <Geoff St. Pierre>
* | | | | | 31b4aab28 - Harden file name munge. (20 hours ago) <quicksketch>
* | | | | | cf5eefd3f - Issue #4758: 1.17.2 regression: Fieldset style renders incorrectly. (21 hours ago) <Gregory Netsas>
The bottom two are expected from the 1.17.3 release. Everything else looks like a local development environment accidentally committed to the master project.
@John Franklin damn, I wonder if it's the backdrop-composer project. That might be my mistake. I double checked my PR before merging but... I'll take a look
Okay, looks like I did add a commit. Not sure how that happened because I also updated the composer project and it also has the one from the main.
@quicksketch @BWPanda need some advice on best way to fix. I'm guessing deleting the commit is not a good idea
What repo are we talking about? I'm confused...
backdrop/backdrop
OK, but how is that related to the Lando/Drush issue...?
I don't know but it's something we need to fix
Indeed. I'd wait for @quicksketch to reply. He should be around in an hour.
Maybe @klonos can bring this to Nate's attention in the meeting...?
I wonder if it happened when I was using GitHub's method of resolving a conflict in a pr? I should have done it from the command line
The accidental commit adds a .lando.yml file (among other things). I couldn't find a general topic here, and didn't want to create a new one.

Right, must be the lando file. I'm pretty sure it's coming from the backdrop-composer project. And happened when I was trying to resolve a conflict between the two projects using the github UI. Working theory
We are talking about a commit to core, right?
Sounds reasonable.
@StPaulTim , yes. See the git history above.
I'm guessing because it's a shared repo that the best we can do is revert the commit.

@Herb @quicksketch Here's a PR to revert the merge: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/pull/3405/files

Revert "Merge branch '1.x' into 1.x" by BWPanda 路 Pull Request #3405 路 backdrop/backdrop
This reverts commit 0b05192, reversing changes made to 31b4aab.
@BWPanda thanks. I was just in the middle of doing that too. I think we can merge yours.
Merge my unmerge of your merge you mean? :big_smile:
